title: Pumpkin Mochi
description: Mochi is a delicious Japanese dessert known for its chewy texture. The addition of pumpkin gives this sweet treat a lovely twist for the fall season.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Japanese Pumpkin Mochi 4.6 (95) 76 Reviews 19 Photos Mochi is a delicious Japanese dessert known for its chewy texture. The addition of pumpkin gives this sweet treat a lovely twist for the fall season. Submitted by PIKALA Updated on September 11, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 19 19 19 19 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 10 mins Servings: 12 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 2 ½ cups mochiko (glutinous rice flour) 2 teaspoons baking powder 2 cups white sugar 4 large eggs 1 (29 ounce) can pumpkin puree 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 cup unsalted butter, melted 2 teaspoons vanilla extract Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish. Sift together mochiko, baking powder, and sugar in a large bowl. Combine eggs, pumpkin puree, condensed milk, butter, and vanilla extract in a separate bowl. Stir egg mixture into mochiko mixture. Pour into the prepared dish. Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour. Allow to cool before serving. I Made It Print 155 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Pumpkin Mochi 01 of 19 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 19 Photo by  Lourdes Luna Williams 11/29/2019 03 of 19 Photo by  Brownie808 11/21/2018 Wow this came out better than I imagined!! I made it for my hubbies job as well as mine to take in to work and everyone including ourselves loved it and asked for the recipe. I had a co-worker who just recently mentioned she hated pumpkin but loved it and even had seconds. Mahalo nui!!! 04 of 19 Photo by  wangtiff 12/06/2017 05 of 19 Photo by  Melissa O'Bitts 10/18/2017 I tested this recipe out a few years ago and loved it. It’s been my fall seasonal treat every year since. It’s always a winner with my family and coworkers! 06 of 19 Photo by  Snacks 12/02/2016 07 of 19 Photo by  cenakin 11/08/2016 08 of 19 Photo by  Brielle Brauner 08/17/2016 Yum! It's not what I expected from mochi, but it's delicious. Great texture, but not like traditional mochi. 09 of 19 Photo by  tisha 02/12/2016 10 of 19 Photo by  Edward Wagner 01/02/2016 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Dairy-Free, Gluten-Free Pumpkin Bars 3 Ratings Pumpkin Rice Pudding 20 Ratings Pumpkin Marshmallows 10 Ratings Pumpkin Protein Cookies 92 Ratings Banana Bran Zucchini Bread 34 Ratings Killer Pumpkin Pie 108 Ratings Tofu Pumpkin Pie 33 Ratings Pumpkin Pot De Creme 8 Ratings Made Me Love Pumpkin Cake 22 Ratings Impossible Pumpkin Pie 163 Ratings Mom's Pumpkin Pie 343 Ratings Butter Mochi 30 Ratings Vegan Pumpkin Ice Cream 3 Ratings Pumpkin Torte II 28 Ratings Pumpkin Custard with a Kick 8 Ratings Chef John's Pumpkin Creme Brulee 41 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: PIKALA
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.;Sift together mochiko, baking powder, and sugar in a large bowl. Combine eggs, pumpkin puree, condensed milk, butter, and vanilla extract in a separate bowl. Stir egg mixture into mochiko mixture. Pour into the prepared dish.;Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour. Allow to cool before serving.
